entry.title: Re: How to configure email sending in TM Public CLoud
entry.content:
Dear @zsoci ,

First of all I would try to understand why Business Partner (Carrier) does not have email address maintained.
Please verify that it is already done from Business Partner perspective and then try to remove & assign carrier to see the email address of Business Partner.
To see the email address determined for Carrier please open Business Partner tab and check Email field. 
Additionally I would recommend to configure Output Parameter Determination table to have output request item created by default with all required attributes. Usually it is enough to configure Output Type, Receiver, Channel, Email Setting (here you could mock sender address & set email template to TM_TOR_DEFAULT_EMAIL_TEMPLATE), Email recipient (set recipient address), Form template, Output relevance.
So with automatically created Output request item you will be just able to use 'Send to Carrier'.

Best Regards,
Slava Aliakseyevets

entry.title: Re: Picking Quantity Problem
entry.content: I could see from your Delivery screen shot, Warehouse Management is active as some warehouse number is there. Please note in delivery processing with WM/EWM active (i.e. a warehouse number is assigned to the plant/storage location), the Picked Qty field is system‑controlled. You cannot enter it manually in the delivery. Instead, picking is executed via Transfer Order (WM) or Warehouse Task (EWM). Once the TO/WT is confirmed, the system automatically updates the Picked Qty in the delivery. This Transfer Order you can create directly from Delivery screen. From top menu bar, click on "Subsequent Functions > Create Transfer Order"

entry.title: Re: Assembly Process -Network Marked For Deletion
entry.content:
Follow the below steps to fix the issue

Go to Extras → Status management → Object status in CN02. Look for DLFL or DLT at header or activity level. If present, remove it (Edit → Status → Delete flag → Reset).

Go to CN08 and ensure the material is assigned to the correct network type and project profile. Delete and re‑create the assignment if needed.

Go to CJ91, and verify that the SD/PS assignment indicator is active. Confirm the project profile used matches the coding mask and network type.

In OVZG, confirm that requirement class 212 has Assembly type = 2 (network). Ensure “Create network” is ticked.

Finally, if the error persists, run report RCNCT001 (Consistency check for networks) to detect hidden inconsistencies. Sometimes, deleting and re‑creating the standard network assignment in CN08 resolves the issue.

entry.title: Trial SAP BTP with Process automation are not maintained with Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)
entry.content:
I am using a trial version of SAP BTP and following the available learning materials for SAP Build Process Automation.

When creating subaccounts in the trial environment, only two regions are available: US East (VA) – AWS and Singapore – Azure

In US East (VA) – AWS, the service SAP Build Process Automation is not listed in the Service Marketplace.
In Singapore – Azure, the service SAP Build Process Automation is available and can be enabled.

Therefore, I enabled SAP Build Process Automation in the Singapore – Azure region. On the Lobby start page, the template "Create an Invoice Approval Process" is provided: Template link.

I followed all the configuration steps as instructed. However, when testing the block "Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)", which should recognize an Invoice-type PDF, the SAP Desktop Agent shows the following error:

 

irpa_core.error.Error: [requestDoxToken] Error on content received: {"name":"requestDoxToken","tid":28,"code":"InvalidCommand","label":"No bean named 'requestDoxToken' available"
According to the SAP Community discussions, the reason might be that "Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)" only works in specific regions: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt) EU Access, Japan (Tokyo), US East (VA) (Source: SAP Community Q&A) This means that with a trial account limited to Singapore – Azure, the template cannot be fully executed, as the Document Information Extraction Service is not available in this region.

Question:
If trial users are provided with SAP Build Process Automation only in Singapore – Azure, why is a template offered that cannot be executed in this region? 

Has anyone else faced this issue in the trial account? Is there a workaround, or is this a known limitation when using SAP Build Process Automation in Singapore – Azure?

And how can we offer Build Process Automation subscriptions to customers if their features can’t even be properly tested in a test environment?

entry.title: Re: MSR_VRM_GR Complete logistical process with goods rec...
entry.content:
In your case, why the checkbox is greyed out is because the option “Complete logistical process with Goods Receipt” in MSR_VRM_GR is only available for unrestricted stock or “normal” stock returns. When the material is special stock E (customer order stock), SAP deliberately disables that option because:

  • the stock is tied to a specific sales order item (VBAP/VBEP).
  • the system expects a new goods receipt posting against the replacement PO to re‑establish the link between the replenished stock and the sales order.
  • Skipping the GR would break the pegging between the sales order requirement and the stock, which is why SAP enforces a fresh inspection/receipt step.

So, in short: with special stock E, you cannot bypass the GR step — that’s why the field is greyed out.

What this means is for sales order stock (E): you must do a replacement PO + GR. The GR is mandatory to re‑assign the stock to the original sales order.

If you want to avoid a second inspection, and if your concern is the inspection lot creation, you can adjust QM control so that the GR against the replacement PO does not trigger a new inspection (e.g. by using a different QM control key or material master setting for returns).

entry.title: Re: Target Value in Inspection Plan/Insp. Lot Based on Ch...
entry.content:
The standard behavior is in SAP QM, inspection plans normally hold static target values and tolerances for each Master Inspection Characteristic (MIC). In Variant Configuration (LO-VC), the sales order carries dynamic values (e.g. Width = 125 mm). By default, the MIC in the inspection plan does not automatically inherit the sales order’s configured value — unless you set up the integration.

To make target values dynamic, SAP provides a way to link class characteristics (used in VC) with inspection characteristics (MICs). The flow is:

Create a class characteristic (CT04)
Same data type/format as your inspection characteristic (numeric, length, decimals). This is the VC characteristic used in the sales order configuration.

Link it to the MIC (QS21 / QS23)
In the MIC, under Additional Data → Control Indicators, assign the class characteristic. This creates the bridge between VC and QM.

Assign the MIC in the inspection plan (QP01/QP02)
Use the MIC in your plan as usual. Don’t hardcode the target value — leave it open to be filled dynamically.

Activate the integration as per SAP Note 119708
SAP requires a modification/activation so that the configured value from the sales order is transferred into the inspection lot. This ensures that when the inspection lot is created, the MIC’s target value is populated with the VC characteristic value (e.g. Width = 125 mm).

So with the above settings, the result would be, when you create a sales order with Width = 125 mm, the inspection lot generated for that order will show Target = 125 mm in the MIC.

entry.title: Re: Tax code and tax jurisdiction codes in ME21N - can yo...
entry.content:
Tax Code (MWSKZ) and Tax Jurisdiction Code (TXJCD) are both determined, but SAP standard does not validate whether the combination is “compatible.” The system assumes that the tax procedure (e.g. TAXUSJ for US, TAXINN for India) will handle the calculation, but it doesn’t stop users from combining an invalid tax code with a jurisdiction code.

Why there is no standard validation is because, in standard SAP, tax code drives the condition records in the pricing procedure. Tax jurisdiction code is derived from plant, delivery address, or account assignment (see SAP Note 493515 for details). SAP does not cross‑validate the two fields because tax rules differ by country and company, and the “compatibility” logic is business‑specific.

If you want to restrict this, try with BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST (method PROCESS_ITEM or CHECK) to add custom validation. Alternatively, use enhancement MM06E005. In your code, read EKPO-MWSKZ (tax code) and EKPO-TXJCD (tax jurisdiction). Compare against a custom Z‑table of valid combinations. If invalid, raise an error message (MESSAGE e...) to stop PO save.

entry.title: Creating a Hybrid CAP (Node.js) Profile with PostgreSQL on BTP from Business Application Studio
entry.content:
In this blog post, I’ll walk you through how to configure a hybrid testing profile in a Node.js-based CAP project, using a PostgreSQL database hosted on BTP, and running it locally from Business Application Studio.

While setting up hybrid profiles in CAP is a common task, using them with PostgreSQL on BTP introduces a few challenges, mainly the need to connect via SSH tunneling to access the remote database from your local BAS workspace.

For more information on hybrid testing in CAP: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/advanced/hybrid-testing 

This blog summarizes the approach I followed to solve a real-world issue raised in the SAP Community (original Q&A here). Thanks to @MioYasutake and @Willem_Pardaens for their help. Worth noting, @MioYasutake has published a great blog covering a complete Java-based CAP example, which you’ll find linked in the answer of this thread.

Table of contents:

  • Prerequisites and Sample Project
  • PostgreSQL specificity on BTP
  • Creating the Hybrid Profile
  • Enable SSH
  • Secure Connection via SSH Tunnel
  • Launch the Application
  • In case of "ResourceRequest timed out" error
  • Conclusion

Prerequisites and Sample Project

In this tutorial, I’ll be using a sample CAP project that was previously created and publicly available on GitHub. If you prefer to start from scratch, you can follow the official setup guide here: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf 

Just make sure to replace HANA Cloud with PostgreSQL by running the following command: 

cds add postgres --for production

Note: The cds add postgres command automatically adds a PostgreSQL resource to your mta.yaml file, using the development service plan by default. However, this plan is not available on BTP trial accounts. If you're using a trial account, simply replace development with trial in the mta.yaml as shown below:

- name: bookshop-postgres
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: postgresql-db
    service-plan: trial

Once the project is deployed to BTP, you’ll see five service instances created:

  • One instance for authorization (XSUAA)
  • One for the destination service
  • Two related to the HTML5 application repository (host and runtime)
  • And one for the PostgreSQL database

This setup represents a standard CAP deployment on Cloud Foundry with an HTML5 UI module.

Additionally, in your Cloud Foundry space, you will find two deployed applications:

  • One for the PostgreSQL database
  • And another for the backend service of your application (the -srv module)

With the basic configuration set up on BTP, we can now move on to implementing hybrid testing from Business Application Studio.

PostgreSQL specificity on BTP

The PostgreSQL service on BTP is not publicly accessible, even from Business Application Studio. It can only be reached by applications deployed within the same BTP subaccount.

To work around this limitation, we will create an SSH tunnel between Business Application Studio and our Cloud Foundry application.

Creating the Hybrid Profile

To set up the hybrid profile, you need to modify or create the .cdsrc.json (or .cdsrv-private.json) file at the root of your CAP project. This file defines launch profiles and specific options for the cds command.

{
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "[hybrid]": {
        "db": {
          "kind": "postgres",
          "credentials": {
            "host": "127.0.0.1",
            "port": 63306,
            "user": "<user>",
            "password": "<password>",
            "database": "<dbname>",
            "sslcert": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----",
            "sslrootcert": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----"
          },
          "pool": {
            "acquireTimeoutMillis": 2000
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Replace the placeholders <user>, <password>, <database>, as well as the <sslcert> and <sslrootcert> fields with the credentials provided by your PostgreSQL instance hosted on BTP.

Direct access to the remote PostgreSQL database is restricted for security reasons. By creating an SSH tunnel, a local port (e.g., 63306) on your BAS environment is securely forwarded to the remote database, so connecting to 127.0.0.1:63306 effectively accesses the remote PostgreSQL instance through this tunnel.

Enable SSH

Before you can connect via SSH to your Cloud Foundry app, you need to enable this feature first by running:

cf enable-ssh bookshop-srv
cf restart bookshop-srv

If you encounter any issues, refer to the official Cloud Foundry SSH documentation: https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/devguide/deploy-apps/ssh-apps.html

Secure Connection via SSH Tunnel

Open a terminal in Business Application Studio and run the following command:

cf ssh -L 63306:<host_from_service_key>:<port_from_service_key> <application_name>

Replace <host_from_service_key> and <port_from_service_key> with the values from your PostgreSQL service key on BTP (create one if it doesn’t exist). Also replace <application_name> with the name of your Cloud Foundry application (e.g., bookshop-srv).

This command creates an SSH tunnel that forwards local port 63306 to the remote PostgreSQL database through the Cloud Foundry app.

Launch the Application

In a second terminal, run the following command to start your application using the hybrid profile:

cds watch --profile hybrid

You should see a message in the console confirming the connection to PostgreSQL on localhost, for example:

[cds] - connect to db > postgres {
  host: '127.0.0.1',
  port: 63306,
  ...
}

Your application now runs locally in Business Application Studio but using the real data from the PostgreSQL database hosted on your BTP account.

In case of "ResourceRequest timed out" error

If you see the following error: 

<message>ResourceRequest timed out</message>

It likely means that:

  • The SSH tunnel is not active
  • The SSL certificate is not loaded properly
  • The timeout is too short (hence the importance of the acquireTimeoutMillis setting)

Conclusion

Once set up, this configuration lets you develop locally from Business Application Studio while testing your application with real data from PostgreSQL. This way, you avoid redeploying the app after every change and fully leverage CAP’s hybrid testing capabilities.

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release - OAuth 2.0 & Improved Document Migration for SuccessFactors to OpenText integration
entry.content:
Introduction

This article is intended for customers who currently use or plan to use, either: 

SAP SuccessFactors Extended Enterprise Content Management by OpenText (xECM), or
SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core by OpenText (Core). 

The 2H 2025 release delivers two important enhancements to SAP SuccessFactors integration with OpenText.

  1. OAuth 2.0 authentication for outbound calls from SuccessFactors to OpenText, and 
  2. Multithreading enhancement for Document Migration to OpenText 

OAuth 2.0 authentication for outbound calls from SuccessFactors to OpenText 

OAuth 2.0 is now available as the authentication method when configuring the Document Management connection from SuccessFactors to OpenText. OAuth 2.0 is an industry-standard authorization protocol that improves security and simplifies integration compared with basic (user ID/password) authentication.

Where to configure

Administrators will find OAuth 2.0 option on the Configure Document Management screen in SuccessFactors when establishing a connection to an OpenText instance.

Recommended approach and migration guidance

  • New implementations: Customers implementing OpenText integration for first time are recommended to adopt OAuth 2.0 from the outset.
  • Existing integrations: Customers currently using User ID/Password (basic authentication) should switch to OAuth 2.0 at their earliest convenience. 

Required steps (high level)

  1. Create a self-signed certificate in SuccessFactors Security Center.
  2. Register the same certificate in the OpenText instance that you plan to connect to.
  3. In the Configure Document Management screen in SuccessFactors, select and use the registered certificate to establish the OAuth 2.0 integration. 

Release and dependency considerations:

  • xECM Customers: OAuth 2.0 support depends on your xECM release version. If your xECM instance is below the required release you must upgrade xECM before switching to OAuth 2.0. Refer to relevant OpenText release-dependency documentation.
  • Deprecation schedule for basic authentication: 
    End of development: November 14, 2025
    End of Maintenance: May 14, 2026 
    Deleted: November 20, 2026
    Full details of deprecation here: Deprecation of Basic Authentication for Integration with Document Management and OpenText 
    Plan your migration accordingly to avoid disruption. 

Certificate rotation and lifecycle

As OAuth 2.0 uses a certificate to authenticate the connection, administrators must manage certificate lifecycle and rotation to prevent service interruptions.

Validity

  • Self-signed certificates created in Security Center can have a maximum validity of three years. 

Expiration Notifications

  • SuccessFactors Security center has the ability to send email notifications prior to certificate expiry.
    Important: Administrators should subscribe to these email notifications to prevent certificate expiration. When subscribed administrators receive email notifications starting 30 days prior to expiry and every week then onwards. 
  • Additionally, the Configure Document Management screen displays the expiration date of the chosen certificate to keep administrators informed. 

Rotation process (recommended approach)

To rotate certificates without interrupting service:

  1. Create a new self-signed certificate in SuccessFactors Security Center. 
  2. Register the new certificate in the OpenText instance in addition to the existing certificate (OpenText supports registering up to two certificates).
  3. In SuccessFactors Configure Document Management, update the integration settings to use the new certificate and re-establish the connection.

Note: As a convention, while registering the certificates in OpenText we recommend appending the newest certificate at the bottom and deleting the oldest (topmost) certificate if there are already two certificates present. This will ensure current and newly created certificates are both valid avoiding any service interruptions. 

References

  • SAP help: Renew Certificate and Maintain OAuth Connection to OpenText
  • Refer to relevant OpenText documentation for steps to be carried out in OpenText for registering the certificate. 

Multithreading enhancement for Document Migration to OpenText 

Overeview

After enabling the OpenText integration, customers must migrate(transfer) existing documents from SuccessFactors native storage to OpenText. The 2H 2025 release introduces parallel processing for the migration job, improving speed and reliability.

Key points

  • No downtime required: Document migration runs in the background and does not require application downtime.
  • Continuous availability: Documents remain available through SuccessFactors application UIs and Manage Documents during and after migration.
  • New uploads: Documents uploaded after integration is enabled are sent directly to OpenText and remain visible in SuccessFactors UIs and Manage Documents.
  • Job frequency and duration: A migration job runs for a maximum of 2 hours and can be scheduled to trigger once every 3 hours.

In the 2H 2025, administrators will find a new field 'Number of Parallel Jobs' on the Job scheduling page in provisioning. This controls the number of parallel threads used by the migration job. The maximum value allowed is 5. 

Recommendations

  • Use parallelization to significantly improve total migration time. The optimal number of parallel jobs depends on your OpenText environment. Work with your OpenText implementation team to select the most suitable value.
  • Note that the job monitor will show one job log entry per job invocation (not per thread). The single log entry will collate statistics across all threads to provide cumulative results for easier monitoring. Example screenshot of job details for one such invocation: 

Monitoring Migration Progress

Previously, it was difficult to get a holistic view of migration progress. With recent updates, use the Check Tool (introduced in 1H 2025) to determine overall migration status. 

How to check progress

  • Use the check “Determine the status of documents migrated to OpenText,” located under Document Management Services: Document Migration to OpenText within the Check Tool. This check shows the overall migration progress across the system.

Reference

  • Blog: 1H 2025 Release Update - Improved Document Migration to OpenText

Summary

The 2H 2025 release strengthens the SuccessFactors ↔ OpenText integration by:

  • Enabling OAuth 2.0 for a more secure and manageable authentication method; and
  • Adding multithreaded migration control to accelerate and stabilize document migration to OpenText.

Next steps

  • Plan your migration from basic authentication to OAuth 2.0 ahead of the deprecation timeline.
  • Subscribe administrators to Security Center certificate expiry notifications and establish a certificate rotation process.
  • Coordinate with your OpenText implementation team to determine the optimal parallel-job setting for migration.

entry.title: Re: Stock transfer order return flag (RETPOS) switches sa...
entry.content:
After some investigation of the documentation in SPRO, I mean that this behavior is "as designed".

The Enhanced Store Return can be used w/o activation of "Advanced Returns Management", meaning that you don't need a separate license.

The process makes sense and works.

  1. The sales area in the return PO is determined from the returning plant because this organization creates the return delivery.
  2. The process includes an inbound delivery for the receiving plant (automatically with SPED output type).
  3. So you can use this process with EWM/TM on both sides.

Read more in your SAP system 😉

entry.title: A Smarter Move from Boomi and MuleSoft to SAP Integration Suite - Assessed, Automated, Validated
entry.content:
We are living in an era of intelligent transformation, a time when the convergence of digital, physical, and biological worlds is reshaping every facet of our existence. Businesses are evolving with almost breathless speed, with enterprises expanding and adopting new applications, systems, and business models. However, this rapid evolution brings forth a surge in complexity, compelling enterprises to modernise their integration landscape in order to simplify connectivity, improve agility, and reduce operational overhead.

Imagine if your systems spoke the same language, data didn’t wait in queues, processes moved with instinct, and not instruction, that’s where SAP Integration Suite takes the lead, not just as a replacement for legacy platforms but as a strategic enabler of digital transformation and landscape consolidation. It silently conducts the symphony weaving APIs, events, processes, and data into a seamless rhythm. Just flowing….

Why Enterprises Are Making the Shift with SAP Integration Suite

Many organisations who started their journey with legacy middleware are now facing:

  • Fragmented integration landscapes across multiple middleware technologies
  • Rising costs associated with platform sprawl
  • Limited visibility and control over end-to-end processes
  • Challenges in scaling integrations across hybrid and multi-cloud environments

SAP Integration Suite provides a compelling alternative offering native integration with SAP and non-SAP systems, support for hybrid and cloud-native scenarios, and a suite of capabilities for API management, event-driven integration, and process orchestration all in one platform. Cohesion becomes essential when the architecture spans multiple middleware solutions. Consolidating your middleware landscape under one middleware platform brings tangible benefits to an enterprise as it reduces total cost of ownership(TCO) through fewer platforms to manage, maintain and operate. In SAP centric environment, moving to SAP Integration Suite has its advantages. However, the path to consolidation isn’t always straightforward, especially if the customer’s landscape has mature middleware platforms like Boomi and MuleSoft.

 Advantages of SAP Integration Suite over Boomi and MuleSoft

  • Smooth Migration from SAP PO/PI
    • SAP Integration Suite: Provides migration automation tool with message mapping automation from SAP PI/PO to SAP IS ensuring smoother transition.
    • MuleSoft/Boomi: No direct migration path, customers must redesign integrations from scratch
  • Pre-Package Integration content
    • SAP Integration Suite: Access to SAP API Business Hub with hundreds of pre-built integration flows (iFlows), APIs, and event packages specifically for SAP business processes.
    • MuleSoft/Boomi: Offer generic templates and accelerators but limited in-depth SAP
  • Native SAP Connectivity
    • SAP Integration Suite: Comes with pre-built adapters and deep integration with SAP applications (S/4HANA, ECC, SuccessFactors, Ariba, Concur, IBP, etc.), ensuring faster implementation and reduced customization.
    • MuleSoft & Boomi: Require third-party connectors or additional customization to integrate seamlessly with SAP landscapes.

Simplifying Migration from MuleSoft and Boomi with an End-to-End Migration Accelerator Tool

To support enterprises who are on a journey to migrate from MuleSoft and Boomi to SAP Integration Suite, we have developed a purpose-crafted accelerator that streamlines the entire lifecycle of migration from MuleSoft and Boomi to SAP Integration Suite. This tool helps assess, automate, validate, and govern migrations at scale reducing manual effort, improving accuracy, and accelerating time to value.

Here’s how it works:

Migration Assessment for MuleSoft & Boomi

  • Analyze's source artifacts (zip/process archives)
  • Identifies APIs, Processes/ Flows, connectors, and backend systems
  • Calculates integration complexity
  • Recommends equivalent SAP adapters
  • Produces a detailed PDF migration report to drive stakeholder alignment

Automated i-Flow Generation

  • Reconstructs source logic into SAP Integration Suite i-Flows
  • Uses pre-built templates for common patterns
  • Offers SAP aligned adapter recommendations through template iflows.
  • Reduces development effort by up to 30%

Mapping Logic Migration

      MuleSoft

  • Parses complex MuleSoft DWL scripts
  • Supports in conversion of DWL to Graphical mapping formats
  • Preserves nested structures and transformation logic
  • Enables plug-and-play use in SAP Integration Suite

      Boomi

  • Conversion of JavaScript to Groovy Script mapping using AI.

Validation & Testing Framework

  • Validation of migrated interfaces.
  • Compares payloads across source and target middleware and flags discrepancies.
  • Reduces test effort significantly.
  • Visual representation of the test results.

Quality Monitoring & Governance Dashboards: enhancing the existing Product monitoring capabilities

  • Provides near real-time visibility into migrated integration flows and API's enhancing the product monitoring capability
  • Customized monitoring alerts and reports of the interfaces based on filters set, through email alerts.
  • Tracks SLA compliance, error trends, and integration health at tenant level
  • AI enabled Error Info chatbot which provides potential causes if error and suggestions  to fix.
  • Version Management dashboard across all tenant in the account.
  • Certificate lifecycle management.
  • Alerting mechanism for failed transactions improving the response time of maintenance and support team.

AI Chatbot for auto documentation of Migration project

  • Generates documents (technical specification, cutover plan etc) associated with migration

So are you ready to modernize Your Middleware Landscape with SAP Integration Suite? Whether you are currently on MuleSoft or Boomi, moving to SAP Integration Suite doesn't have to be daunting. With the right approach and the right tools, you can migrate with confidence, reduce risks, and unlock a future-ready integration landscape with end-to-end automation.

Reach out to learn how we can support your middleware transformation from MuleSoft or Boomi to SAP Integration Suite.

entry.title: Re: Manual Accrual getting reversed at the time of Delta...
entry.content:
Hi @priya_sshekhar ,

I agree with @GauthierVictor and @Lakshmipathi that the recommended approach is to include the legacy data somehow into the business volume (Multiple options exist like proforma documents or an additional business volume table). Both also listed some other reasonable options.

Another option is the use of an absolut amount accrual condition. The first delta accrual will post this accrual. The absolut amount delta accrual is independent from the business volume. Absolut amount accrual and business volume related accrual add up. Both are reversed during final settlement.

 You find further documentation in  2564353 - Condition Contract Management: Product Overview Documents - SAP for Me. From there you can access the document "Condition Contracts for Fixed Amounts". Slide 36 is the best match for your requirement. In your case you only need a single accrual condition and a fixed settlement condition is not required.

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

You’re right to point this out—S/4HANA Public Cloud operates on UTC, and not all apps convert timestamps to the user’s local time. Some Fiori apps respect the user’s Language & Region → Time Zone setting; others, particularly classic UIs or specific apps, display UTC. This is intentional, not a flaw. SAP Support Portal-3514300 - Time zone Explanation - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In your example of Manage Global Hierarchies (F2918), the process is date-driven. The outcomes are based on the Valid On key date, which is a date field. Therefore, whether the time is local or UTC does not affect what you see; it is the selected date and the validity of hierarchy nodes/texts over time that matter. If users believe the data is incorrect, they should first verify the Valid On date. SAP Help Portal

If you're looking for a practical way ahead, here’s a clear plan.

Make it reproducible: demonstrate one app that converts to local time and another that displays UTC, with your FLP time-zone setting visible. Some UI5 apps honour FLP time-zone configuration; see recent UI5/Fiori guidance, SAP Community-Smart Controls Support Time-Zone Configuration from the SAP Fiori Launchpad

You may ask SAP to standardise TZ handling across apps via Customer Influence, with a clear request: apply the user’s FLP time zone consistently to all Fiori apps that display timestamps. SAP Community-SAP Continuous Influence for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition - Session List and Rules of Engagement

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Responsible Vibe Coding Tutorial: Building a Meeting Room CAP App
entry.content:
🎯What is Vibe Coding?

Vibe coding means collaborating with AI assistants to build apps step by step, entirely through natural language prompts. Instead of writing everything yourself, you “vibe” with AI to generate, refine, and optimize code.

This tutorial shows how to build a Meeting Room Booking app with CAP + AI Core, entirely through prompts — from schema to service, business logic, AI integration, and a simple UI.

 

Quick prerequisites

  • VS Code + Cline extension (or your Claude integration)
  • Node.js (v18+) and @SAP/cds-dk (CAP CLI)
  • SAP BTP account with AI Core (for production); we include a dev fallback.
  • Git repo and .clinerules set up (recommended)

Step 0 — Plan first (Cline Plan mode)

Always start with a short Plan prompt to the AI (Cline Plan mode). Example plan template:

Plan:

- Goal: Add a MeetingRoom CAP service with Book/Cancel/Search and a recommendRoom AI action.

- Acceptance criteria: CDS created + seed data; BookService exposing actions; recommendRoom returns top-3 rooms with reasons; endpoints testable via curl.

- Assumptions: No auth (dev), timezone = UTC, single-tenant.

- Edge cases: overlapping bookings, zero-capacity rooms, invalid room IDs.

- Tests: curl examples for create/search/recommend and a UI smoke test.

Part 1: Setting Up the Environment

🎤The Prompt:

Set up a new CAP project for a meeting room booking system.

💡What Happened:
The AI guided installation, created a new CAP project, and initialized dependencies.

Generated Commands:

npm install -g @SAP/cds-dk

cds init meeting-vibe

cd meeting-vibe

npm install

Key Learning: Always start with a clean project skeleton before vibing features.

Part 2: Creating the Data Model

🎤The Prompt:

Create a data model with Rooms and Bookings. Rooms have capacity, location, amenities, and availability. Bookings track user, room, start/end times, and status. Include seed data.

💡What Happened:
The AI generated the core CDS schema and sample CSV seed files.

📂Generated Schema:

namespace vibe.meetings;

 

entity Rooms : cuid, managed {

  name      : String(111) not null;

  location  : String(111);

  capacity  : Integer;

  amenities : String;

  available : Boolean default true;

}

 

entity Bookings : cuid, managed {

  room    : Association to Rooms;

  userId  : String(36);

  start   : Timestamp;

  end     : Timestamp;

  purpose : String(255);

  status  : String(20) default 'CONFIRMED';

}

Key Learning: A single domain-level prompt is enough to generate a correct schema with relationships.

Part 3: Adding the Service Layer

🎤The Prompt:

Expose the Rooms and Bookings as a BookingService with actions: bookRoom, cancelBooking, searchAvailableRooms, and recommendRoom.

💡What Happened:
The AI produced a full CDS service definition.

📂Generated Service Definition:

service BookingService {

  entity Rooms as projection on vibe.meetings.Rooms;

  entity Bookings as projection on vibe.meetings.Bookings;

 

  action bookRoom(roomId: UUID, userId: String, start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, purpose: String) returns Bookings;

  action cancelBooking(bookingId: UUID) returns String;

  function searchAvailableRooms(start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, minCapacity: Integer) returns array of Rooms;

  action recommendRoom(start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, attendees: Integer, prefs: String) returns array of {

    roomId: UUID;

    score: Decimal(5,2);

    reason: String;

  };

}

Key Learning: The AI can infer the exact CRUD operations and business functions you need if you describe them clearly.

Part 4: Business Logic Implementation

🎤The Prompt:

Implement handlers for bookRoom, cancelBooking, and searchAvailableRooms in JavaScript with validation and error handling.

💡What Happened:
The AI generated a srv/book-service.js with full logic for booking, cancelling, and searching.

📂Example Implementation:

this.on('bookRoom', async (req) => {

  const { roomId, userId, start, end, purpose } = req.data;

  if (new Date(start) >= new Date(end)) req.error(400, 'Invalid time range');

  const overlap = await SELECT.one.from(Bookings).where`room=${roomId} AND start < ${end} AND end > ${start}`;

  if (overlap) req.error(409, 'Room already booked');

  const booking = await INSERT.into(Bookings).entries({ room_ID: roomId, userId, start, end, purpose });

  return booking;

});

Key Learning: When you ask for validation + error handling, the AI adds production-quality safeguards.

Part 5: AI-Powered Recommendations

🎤The Prompt:

Add AI integration with SAP AI Core to suggest the best rooms. Include a fallback heuristic when AI Core is not configured.

💡What Happened:
The AI created srv/ai-recommender.js, with both AI Core and fallback logic.

📂Example Snippet:

async recommendRooms({ start, end, attendees, prefs, rooms }) {

  if (!this.config.clientId) {

    return rooms.map(r => ({

      roomId: r.ID,

      score: r.capacity >= attendees ? 80 : 50,

      reason: `Capacity ${r.capacity} vs ${attendees}`

    })).slice(0,3);

  }

  // AI Core integration here...

}

Key Learning: Always request a fallback path — AI assistants can build graceful degradation into your app.

Part 6: Building a Simple UI

🎤The Prompt:

Create a simple SAP UI5 page with fields for start/end time, attendees, preferences, and a button to call recommendRoom. Show results in a table.

💡What Happened:
The AI created view/Main.view.xml with a table bound to the recommendation endpoint.

📂Example View Snippet:

<VBox>

  <DateTimePicker id="start"/>

  <DateTimePicker id="end"/>

  <Input id="attendees" placeholder="Attendees"/>

  <Input id="prefs" placeholder="Preferences"/>

  <Button text="Recommend" press=".onRecommend"/>

  <Table id="tblRooms">...</Table>

</VBox>

Key Learning: Even complex UI scaffolding can be generated quickly when you specify layout + bindings.

Part 7: Documentation & Testing

🎤The Prompt:

Create a TESTING_GUIDE.md with curl commands to test all service actions.

💡What Happened:
The AI wrote a full Markdown testing guide with:

  • curl for bookRoom, cancelBooking, searchAvailableRooms, recommendRoom
  • expected responses
  • error case examples

Key Learning: Ask for docs and tests explicitly — they are as important as code.

🎯Best Practices for Responsible Vibe Coding

  • Engineer > AI: Review, understand, and own every line.
  • Test Before You Trust: Validate edge cases with curl or UI.
  • Plan First: Use Cline Plan mode before big prompts.
  • Fallbacks Matter: Always ask AI to build dev-safe fallbacks.
  • Docs Are Not Optional: Generate and maintain documentation with prompts.

🏗️ What We Built Together

Through prompts alone, we created:

  • 📊Data Layer: Rooms & Bookings entities with seed data
  • 🔧Business Logic: Booking, cancellation, search with validations
  • 🤖AI Integration: Room recommendations with AI Core + fallback
  • 🎨UI: Simple SAP UI5 page for booking and recommendations
  • 📚Docs: A testing guide for backend and UI

🎉Congratulations!

You’ve just built a Meeting Room Booking CAP app by vibing with AI — responsibly. The secret: always combine AI’s speed with your engineering judgment.

📖Learn More

  • SAP CAP Documentation
  • SAP AI Core Documentation
  • Cline Extension

entry.title: Re: BTP CIS Provisioning Job fail with error
entry.content:
Hi,

Most probably in your source system in IAS source system the affected user does not have a userName configured.

In the joblog, you can set the property "ips.trace.failed.entity.content = true", so you are able to see the content payload from the failed entity.
Probably you'll see the username empty.
   "userName": "",

You can set a userName to the user via the user Management tab and try to sync again.

BR,
Arilsson

entry.title: Re: SAP IDM: Digit change on EntryId causes selection of...
entry.content:
Who can access a form depends

  1. on the form's access controls chosen by the form developer at designtime
  2. depending on the the specific access control, on the logged in user's identity, privilege or role assignment at runtime

With these instruments, you can apply functional access control in a pretty straight-forward way, e.g.

  • IDM admins can access all forms
  • business users can only access specific forms like "Change Own Data", "Request New Role" etc.

If you need not only functional, but instance-level access control, such as

  • members of role "ADMIN_US" can access the form "Edit User" only for US-based MX_PERSON
  • members of role "ADMIN_EU" can do the same only for EU-based MX_PERSON

you'll need to go one step further and implement instance-level access control, e.g. using search attribute and user attribute configured on the entry type MX_PERSON. This will control the visibility of MX_PERSON in search. Entries whose search attribute does not match the logged in user's user attribute will be filtered out from search results automatically and hence be hidden.

Form access control's can also be configured to provide instance-level access control, typically by defining (SQL) Filters in the access control's On Behalf Of field.

With all that said, the ability to change the URL is not a problem. With access control properly configured, you can pretty much edit the direct links as you want: you should get an Access Denied response whenever trying a URL to an entry or form that's not allowed for you.

entry.title: Re: Extension Point for Custom Logic for EWM Outbound Del...
entry.content:
Dear @lockpicking 

In Custom Fields app choose business context below, one for header and second for item

 

After published field, you will be able to add your own field like below (Fiori app Manage Outbound Delivery Orders) in Adapt UI mode: 

 

 

Make the field available to the print form Still in Custom Fields, open your field and enable it for Form Templates / UIs & Reports (data source). If a data source extension is required, follow SAP’s procedure to extend a form template’s data source so the custom field appears in the form’s data connection.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/c70d06ed39f34108b520e85dcc7de0c5.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Put the field on the EWM Loading List form Open Maintain Form Templates. For EWM’s loading list, copy the delivered EWM_LOADING_LIST template (that’s the one you adapt for the EWM loading instruction/list).

Download the form, open it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer, bind your custom field from the data connection and place it on the layout.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/87f9b54f9c4f4e75aff0061860a6589a/c70d06ed39f34108b520e85dcc7de0c5.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

 

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 2nd, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Devtoberfest Week 2 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-what-is-happening-week-2/ba-p/14233248#M800 

 

Petoberfest 

  • Blog post for uploading pictures: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-2-petoberfest/ba-p/14209744 

 

reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

  • reCAP 2025 (Yellow Room Track) playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLJDFklpD_2cT6lFS3kSq55bUmzTUi9bn7 

 

Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

  • Scavenger Hunt main Blog post : https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 

 

What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – 2025/Q3 

  • What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – September 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-hana-cloud-september-2025/ba-p/14228564 
  • Release highlights: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/thomashammersap_saphanacloud-innovation-clouddata-activity-7376676583241195520-5nz6/ 
  • Calculation View Features of 2025 QRC3: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/calculation-view-features-of-2025-qrc3/ba-p/14192411 
  • 🔵 Leveraging Calculation Views in SAP BAS: an Introduction: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/leveraging-calculation-views-in-sap-bas-an-introduction/ec-p/14208844#M1081 
  • 🔵 Developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications with SAP Business Application Studio and Joule: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/developing-ai-driven-sap-hana-cloud-applications-with-sap-business/ev-p/14220020  

 

Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/call-for-community-talk-speakers-step-into-the-spotlight-at-sap-teched-on/ba-p/14226945 

 

UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

  • Call for Proposals: https://openui5.org/ui5con/bengaluru2025/index.html 
  • SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?PRODUCT=73554900100800001361&range=CURRENT-LAST#Q4%202025 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Week 2 
 
0:31 Petoberfest  

1:48 reCAP 2025 Yellow Room Track (Audimax) sessions now on YouTube 

2:37 Scavenger Hunt Clue #4 

4:03 What’s New in SAP HANA Cloud – 2025/Q3 

5:36 Call for Community Talk Speakers SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore 2025 

6:40 UI5con 2025 Bangalore Call for Proposals & SAPUI5 Road Map Explorer 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 2nd, 2025.

[Kevin] Hey everyone, week one of Devtoberfest is almost over. If you want to check out what activities we've planned for week two, head over to the community, to the Devtoberfest group, and look out for the blog post, Devtoberfest, week two activities. See you there.

[Daniel] I'm here with Pepper, a flat coat retriever, to announce Petoberfest, where you can upload a picture of your pet, or your favorite zoo creature, or stuffed animal, or any furry friend you fancy. Just upload the picture as a comment to my blog post. In addition, use that picture as the basis for an AI-generated image of your pet. For example, hybris Pepper helping me with my Devtoberfest crosswords and wearing her favorite hat. Be creative both in the setup and the style. Petoberfest this year coincides with World Animal Day, so you can also upload a picture of yourself taking part in any animal welfare project. For example, renovating a straight cat hotel or walking to raise money for your local ASPCA. if you upload a picture you will win oodles of points for the devtoberfest grand prize so i'm looking forward to seeing a picture of your pet good news for all you cat fans the rest of the session

[DJ] recordings from recap 2025 are now online on youtube for your queuing and viewing pleasure now we already had the recordings of the sessions from the blue room track on the recap on conference youtube channel and now after getting hold of the recording from the audimax theater we've got the sessions from the yellow room track cut and organized into individual videos and they're in a playlist for you as well the playlist follows the agenda order. And yes, we processed everything with a little bash script and everything on the command line. The future really is terminal.

[Shrini] The scavenger hunt event runs across multiple weeks of Devtoberfest. I hope you already figured out the three clues we gave out and you have a 12-digit hexadecimal number with you. If not, you may pause this video and check out the clues we released earlier from the main blog post on the scavenger end and come back for the fourth clue. For the fourth clue we can explore some github repositories as the clue is hidden in one of the repositories. Many of you may be aware of the SAP GitHub org SAP samples. It contains sample code, TechEd tutorials, Code Jam material and hundreds of reports from which you can learn about ABAP, CAP, BUILD, and other SAP-related technology. Among the various repos, take a closer look at the SAP BTP AI Best Practices repo to find the two-character clue. This repo contains best practices, sample implementations, to build AI-powered applications and serves as a practical guide for developers looking to implement enterprise-grade AI solutions using SAP AI services and integration with generative AI models. To find the clue number four, you don't have to clone the repo. You can look around the repo, access various tabs, search within the repo for some common terms related to desktop office like build, ABAP, CAP, AI, etc. Happy hunting!

[Witalij] Before we dive in, a quick note. Our cat Felicia decided it was the perfect time for an app, so she's not joining today. But I'm here and there is plenty to share. We've just released the third SAP HANA Cloud update of 2025, packed with meaningful advancements. Here are a few highlights I've personally chosen. Vector embedding SQL functions now supports the generative AI hub, helping you integrate different models more easily. JSON is now a native data type in the document store, simplifying work with the unstructured data. Single sign-on for data lake files enhances security and accessibility. And with drill in SAP build code, you can generate SQL from natural language, making development faster and more intuitive, and you can feel like a wipe coder now. For all the details, check out the dedicated blog post or the product team's teaser video. If data modeling is your focus. Don't miss Jan Zwickal's deep-dive post on the latest in graphical view modeling. He also spoke at Devtoberfest this week. Recordings are already available, if you missed it. Finally, mark your calendar for next Thursday as well, as Christoph Morgan will explore developing AI-driven SAP HANA Cloud applications live at Devtoberfest. It's a great chance to see these features in action? Let us know what stands out to you.

[Tom] If you're in the India region, we've got an interesting opportunity for you to join the SAP TechEd On Tour in Bangalore coming up at the end of November. The community talk call for speakers is now open. If you're interested in sharing your experience or your knowledge about a particular topic in the SAP Space, this is your opportunity to get a free lecture only ticket to the SAP TechEd on Tour taking place in Bangalore. You only have until October 10th to submit your session proposal, so be sure to act quickly. We look forward to seeing you at TechEd Berlin as most of the developer advocates team will be there. We'll be cheering you on and helping mentor you for your presentation as well. So this is a great opportunity for anybody looking to get a ticket to TechEd on Tour Bangalore and to share their knowledge at the event. So look forward to seeing you there.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the developer news. Your 5-card 2025 in Bangalore is going to happen in December and the call for proposals is now open. You can submit your session proposal until October 31st. There is quickfire presentations, around 20 minutes long, in-depth sessions, 40 minutes, or longer hands-on workshops. Definitely check that out if you want to have a session at UI5Con in Bangalore. Also related to UI5, there is a new version of the SAP UI5 RoadMavic store with some interesting items on there regarding AI, obviously. There is new AI related controls and also interesting MCP items. So definitely check that one out if you are interested in SAPUI5. All right, hope to talk to you soon. Bye.
